arts.ttl: Stevenage boss on fantastic 4-1 win over Exeter City
arts.sum: Revell said: “It wasn't the start we wanted but I think that's the first time we've come from behind this season to win. It means they have now recorded three wins in the last three League One games, the previous two both coming away from the Lamex and including the 3-2 success at Wrexham on Tuesday.

arts.ttl: Exeter City suffer another heavy defeat after 4-1 loss to Stevenage
arts.sum: Dan Kemp sealed the win 15 minutes from time when he fired home on the rebound after his initial effort was blocked. Cheick Diabate gave the ball away and while an initial effort was cleared off the line, Jordan Roberts smashed home the rebound.

arts.ttl: Exeter City defeats 'not acceptable' - but 'results will turn around' - Devon Live
arts.sum: When Josh Magennis had put City ahead from the penalty spot in just the second minute, hopes of ending the winless run were raised. Roberts with his second of the game ended any slight hope City had with a fourth in the latter stages.

arts.ttl: Stevenage enjoy 4-1 win at home to Exeter City in League One
arts.sum: The penalty was still given though and Magennis sent it to the right of Murphy Cooper, the keeper going the wrong way. Four minutes later, with Exeter at sixes and sevens, Reid escaped down the right and when he got into the box, he squared to Roberts who blasted it into the roof of the net from eight yards.

arts.ttl: Things have been a bit tricky in the league for Exeter City
arts.sum: It’s a busy time here at Exeter City as we gear up for our FA Cup match against Nottingham Forest. It’s just one more good reason to become a Trust member and it means not only do you get priority when it comes to the big games, but your small gesture of joining adds up to something huge for the trust and ultimately the club.

arts.ttl: Exeter City re-sign Ryan Trevitt for a second loan spell
arts.sum: Exeter City manager Gary Caldwell feels the Grecians are getting a better Ryan Trevitt than the one they had before after the midfielder returned to Devon for a second loan spell from Premier League side Brentford. “I have known him from my playing days and speak with him regularly, but then, I have connections now with David Langridge, the loan manager, and Lee Dykes and I think the big thing is that they trust us with their players.

arts.ttl: Alex Hartridge returns to Exeter City as loan deal completed
arts.sum: After Ryan Trevitt rejoined on loan this afternoon, defender Alex Hartridge has returned to Exeter City on loan from Wycombe Wanderers until the end of the season, subject to EFL approval. Having only featured 14 times for the Chairboys, he has now returned to the club as Gary Caldwell looks to bolster his defensive options for the remainder of the campaign.

arts.ttl: Millenic Alli joins Luton Town from Exeter City
arts.sum: Joe Gorman, CEO of Exeter City Football Club, said: “Part of the club’s vision is to develop players from both inside and outside the Academy. His journey from the National League to the Championship in 12 months with the club is a testament to our commitment to player progression, making Exeter City an attractive club for emerging talent.”

arts.ttl: Exeter City have to get things right and turn bad run around
arts.sum: AFTER a run that has brought just two wins and just ten points in 15 games, then you can understand why some Exeter City fans are calling for the head of manager Gary Caldwell. Last season, Caldwell’s Grecians endured a similar sorry spell which also led to him coming under fire, but the manager and his players turned things around, thanks to a productive January transfer window in which the players that came in made a difference and shot the Grecians back up the league table.

arts.ttl: Stevenage stroll past Exeter to make it four wins in a row
